intro: Parsonsia empetrifolia, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in panicles. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Parsonsia empetrifolia is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
